item.title: Why Sebastian?
item.description: ##Unfinished On social occasions, I go by Sebastian. I get a lot of “Oh, and it is …” Of course, that’s not my given name. I chose it somehow arbitrarily when I was taking French in high school (You know how it went since I never bring that up). But I gave myself several very good reasons to stick to it until today. First: It’s LOOOOOOONG! Sebastian is a refined choice among today’s boy names, standing out with his posh feel and substantial size.

item.title: Welcome to my World!
item.description: See more of me from about, with selected projects, professional experiences and others. Contact me via LinkedIn or email me for my resume or opportunities. News: 09/02/2022: I started my master’s degree at Columbia University as well as a new chapter of my life in NYC! 08/19/2022: I finished my internship at Tesla. 07/01/2022: I graduated Magna Cum Laude from Peking University.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I usually go by Sebastian, a name not of my heritage but somehow I feel connected to (See Why Sebastian?). My fields of interest encompass database systems, software engineering, high-performance computing, and time series analysis. I used to aim for a career as a quantitative developer but I took a sharp turn into Computer Science (See Detour to Quant), and I’m convinced that I’ve made the right decision. I feel extremely privileged to be working with and constantly inspired by brilliant minds.
